alert.note: Alert for Bernalillo (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 18 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central and north central New Mexico, including the following counties, in central New Mexico, Bernalillo and Valencia. In north central New Mexico, Sandoval. * WHEN...Until 900 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 600 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. - Up to one inch of rain could fall in the next hour in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Albuquerque, Rio Rancho, Bernalillo, Corrales, Los Ranchos De Albuquerque, Bosque Farms, Paradise Hills, Cabezon, Rio Rancho Intel Area, South Valley, North Valley, Northern Meadows, Vista Hills, Rio Rancho City Center, Isleta Pueblo, Mariposa, Sandia Pueblo, Enchanted Hills, Coronado State Monument and Santa Ana Pueblo. - This includes the following highways... Highway 550 between Mile Markers 1 and 8. Interstate 25 between Mile Markers 207 and 241. Interstate 40 between Mile Markers 134 and 166. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
